Description: The most iconic landmark of Paris, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city.
Activities: Ascend to the different levels, enjoy a meal at the Jules Verne restaurant, take pictures with the tower as a backdrop.

Description: One of the world's largest and most renowned museums, housing a vast collection of art and artifacts.
Activities: Admire masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo, explore various art collections spanning centuries, take a guided tour.

Description: Renowned for its collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art, housed in a beautiful former train station.
Activities: See works by Monet, Renoir, Van Gogh, and other famous artists, explore the vast collection spread across different floors, participate in temporary exhibitions.

Description: A magnificent Gothic cathedral, a symbol of Paris and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Activities: Admire the stunning architecture, explore the interior with its stained glass windows and religious artifacts, attend a mass or religious service (if open to the public).
Best Months to Visit: Year-round (currently undergoing renovations, check for limited access)

Description: A triumphal arch on the Champs-Élysées, commemorating those who fought and died for France in the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.
Activities: Climb to the top for panoramic views, witness the eternal flame at the base, learn about its historical significance.

Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and former royal residence, known for its grandeur, expansive gardens, and historical significance.
Activities: Explore the State Apartments, marvel at the Hall of Mirrors, wander through the gardens with fountains and sculptures, take a guided tour.

Description: A scenic way to see the city from a different perspective, offering views of iconic landmarks.
Activities: Take a daytime or nighttime cruise, enjoy commentary on the sights, relax and soak in the atmosphere.

Description: A charming hilltop neighborhood with a bohemian atmosphere, known for its Sacré-Coeur basilica and vineyards.
Activities: Visit the Sacré-Coeur for panoramic views, explore the streets and shops, stroll through the vineyards and learn about their history.

Description: A historic district known for its prestigious universities, intellectual atmosphere, and charming cafes.
Activities: Explore the Sorbonne University and other landmarks, browse the bookshops, enjoy a coffee or meal at a traditional cafe.

Description: A beautiful public park offering a peaceful escape from the city.
Activities: Relax on the lawns, explore the formal gardens and greenhouses, enjoy a picnic lunch, visit the Medici Fountain.
